intro: Fevillea pedata, commonly known as the featherleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are followed by distinctive, pappus-equipped seeds that aid in wind dispersal. Fevillea pedata is often found in regions with temperate climates and well-drained soils.
